noun.description: A member of a group of proto-Malay peoples of Mindanao in the Philippines.
Any of various dialects comprising a subdivision of the Southern Philippine subgroup of the Malayo-Polynesian language family.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Manobo or their language.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in American Anthropologist. Manobo self-designation, lit. river people.
